concept.title: Link - Using the Links Eclipse Plugin

section.title: Using the Links Plugin in the Eclipse IDE
section.p: To open the Links Wizard got adding a link, open a text file such as a java source file or an xml file, and right click on the file where you want to add a link, and go to the 'Docfacto' menu and then select 'Create link' or alternatively you can click 'Ctrl-Alt-L' as a shortcut.

ol.li: The current file you are adding the link to.
The file type of the current file you are adding the link to.
The file you are linking the current file to.
The key to match this link with the corresponding link in the target file.

The type of link this is.
For example, if the current file is a source file and the target file is a doc file, then the type should be 'link-to-doc'.
The file type of the target file.
Metadata for extra data you may want which isn't supported by links.

section.title: Linking a source file to a documentation file
section.p:
For example, to link a 'java' source file to a 'dita' documentation file:
Open the source file you want to add the link to in eclipse.
Set the current file type to 'java'.
Browse for and select the dita file you want to link the source file with.
Enter the key and version for that link.
Set the 'type of link' to 'link-to-doc'
Set the target file type to 'xml' (because dita files are treated as xml)
Enter any metadata you may need.

section.title: Linking a doc file to a documentation file
section.p:
For example, to link a 'dita' doc file to a 'java' source file:
Open the dita file you want to add the link to in eclipse.
Set the current file type to 'xml'.
Browse for and select the java file you want to link the source file with.
Enter the key and version for that link.
Set the 'type of link' to 'link-to-source'
Set the target file type to 'java'
Enter any metadata you may need.
